intro: Patagonium villanuevae, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, harsh climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, herbaceous stems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
